Definition: In this task, you will be given a text and a title. The title is present in the text and refers to the entity in the text. The title might have some text in parentheses, for example: "HMS Mallow (K81)", or be slightly different from what is present in the text. If they still refer to the same entity, then it is a correct title. Indicate your answer as "Yes" if the title is correct, otherwise indicate your answer as "No".

Positive Examples.input:
Text: The Mansfield Building Society is a UK building society which has its headquarters in Mansfield Nottinghamshire. It is a member of the Building Societies Association. 
Title: Mansfield Building Society
Positive Examples.explanation: The title "Mansfield Building Society" is present in the text and it is the main entity that is referred in the text. Hence, it is the title of the document.

Positive Examples.input:
Text:  The third and current HMS Argyll is a Type 23 'Duke' Class frigate. She is currently the oldest serving Type 23 frigate in the Royal Navy. Like all of her class she is named for a British dukedom in this case that of Argyll. 
Title: HMS Argyll (F231)
Positive Examples.explanation: "HMS Argyll" is present in the text and it is the main entity that is referred in the text. Here, the text in parentheses "F31" is not present in the document and it can be ignored. Hence, the output is correct.

Negative Examples.input:
Text: The Mansfield Building Society is a UK building society which has its headquarters in Mansfield Nottinghamshire. It is a member of the Building Societies Association. 
Title: Mansfield Building Society
Negative Examples.explanation: The title "Mansfield Building Society" is present in the text and it is the main entity that is referred in the text. Hence, the output is incorrect.

Negative Examples.input:
Text:  The third and current HMS Argyll is a Type 23 'Duke' Class frigate. She is currently the oldest serving Type 23 frigate in the Royal Navy. Like all of her class she is named for a British dukedom in this case that of Argyll. 
Title: HMS Argyll (F231)
Negative Examples.explanation: The output should be either "Yes" or "No". Hence, it is negative example.

Instances.input:
Text:  Jonas Andersson Junkka (born May 4 1976) is a retired Swedish professional ice hockey defenceman. He was drafted by the Pittsburgh Penguins in the 1994 NHL Entry Draft being selected in the 4th round 104th overall. 
Title: Black Butte Union Elementary School District

Text:  Keefer Station Covered Bridge is a historic wooden covered bridge located at Upper Augusta Township in Northumberland County Pennsylvania. It is a 109-foot-long (33 m) Burr Truss bridge constructed in 1888. It crosses the Shamokin Creek.It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1979. 
Title: Keefer Station Covered Bridge

Text:  Jabłonka [jaˈbwɔnka] is a village in the administrative district of Gmina Poddębice within Poddębice County Łódź Voivodeship in central Poland. 
Title: Jabłonka Łódź Voivodeship

Text:  Propulsion Universelle et Récuperation d'Énergie (PURE; English: Universal Propulsion and Energy Recovery) is a motorsports engineering company founded by former British American Racing team principal Craig Pollock in 2011. It aims to design and manufacture engines for use under the projected 2014 Formula One technical regulations that mandate a switch from the current normally aspirated V8 engines to turbocharged V6 engines. 
Title: Propulsion Universelle et Recuperation d'Energie

Text:  ACS Nano is a monthly peer-reviewed scientific journal first published in August 2007 by the American Chemical Society. The current editor in chief is Paul S. Weiss (University of California Los Angeles). The journal publishes original research articles reviews perspectives interviews with distinguished researchers views on the future of nanoscience and nanotechnology. 
Title: ACS Nano

Text:  Kolahoi Peak is a mountain with a peak elevation of 17799 ft (5425 metres) in Anantnag district of Jammu and Kashmir in the vicinity of Sonamarg. Kolahoi Peak is part of the Himalaya Range and is located between 15 km south of Sonamarg and 21 km north from Arin Pahalgam. To its north flows the Sind River and the glacier of its name Kolahoi Glacier is the source of Lidder River. in the vicinity of Kashmir valley. 
Title: Włodzimierz Korcz

Text:  Hedge mustard (Sisymbrium officinale) is a plant in the family Brassicaceae. It is found on roadsides and wasteland and as a weed of arable land. A native of Europe and North Africa it is now well-established throughout the world.It is distinct from the mustard plants which belong to the genus Brassica.The Hedge-mustard is food for the caterpillars of some Lepidoptera such as the small white (Pieris rapae). 
Title: Sisymbrium officinale

Text:  The Barguelonne (French: la Barguelonne) is a 61.2 km (38.0 mi) long river in the Lot Tarn-et-Garonne and Lot-et-Garonne départements southwestern France. Its source is near Terry a hamlet in Pern. It flows generally southwest. It is a right tributary of the Garonne into which it flows between Golfech and Lamagistère.Its main tributary is the Barguelonnette. 
Title: Barguelonne
